title: Edda Garðarsdóttir
text:
Edda Garðarsdóttir (born 15 July 1979) is an <a href="Icelanders">Icelandic</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> coach and former player who last managed <a href="%C3%9Arvalsdeild%20%28women%29">Úrvalsdeild</a> club <a href="KR%20women%27s%20football">KR</a>. Since her debut in 1997 she has accrued over 100 <a href="Cap%20%28sports%29">caps</a> for <a href="Iceland%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Iceland's national team</a> and competed at the <a href="UEFA%20Women%27s%20Euro%202009">UEFA Women's Euro 2009</a> finals in Finland.
Club career.
After a spell in Denmark with <a href="Vorup%20Frederiksberg%20Boldklub">Vorup FB</a>, Edda enrolled at the <a href="University%20of%20Richmond">University of Richmond</a> and played <a href="college%20soccer">college soccer</a> for the Richmond Spiders.
From 2009 until 2012 Edda, a <a href="box-to-box">box-to-box</a> <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a>, played club football in Sweden for <a href="KIF%20%C3%96rebro%20DFF">KIF Örebro DFF</a>. Along with <a href="%C3%93l%C3%ADna%20Gu%C3%B0bj%C3%B6rg%20Vi%C3%B0arsd%C3%B3ttir">Ólína Guðbjörg Viðarsdóttir</a>, she moved to <a href="Chelsea%20L.F.C.">Chelsea Ladies</a> of the English <a href="FA%20WSL">FA WSL</a> in January 2013. An interview Edda gave in May 2013 revealed that club rules prevented Ladies players from talking to their male clubmates, unless the male player had initiated the conversation. In July the duo left Chelsea to sign for Valur in their homeland.
International career.
When national team <a href="Coach%20%28sports%29">coach</a> <a href="Sigur%C3%B0ur%20Ragnar%20Eyj%C3%B3lfsson">Siggi Eyjólfsson</a> named his Iceland squad for <a href="UEFA%20Women%27s%20Euro%202013">UEFA Women's Euro 2013</a> in June 2013, Edda was conspicuously absent from the list.
Personal life.
In June 2012 Edda's partner <a href="%C3%93l%C3%ADna%20Gu%C3%B0bj%C3%B6rg%20Vi%C3%B0arsd%C3%B3ttir">Ólína Guðbjörg Viðarsdóttir</a> gave birth to the couple's first child, a daughter.
